page.title: 13HILL FARM, COVENTRY.
page.content: During the winter months the cows are kept in an enclosed area. It is completely self-contained,the cows are allowed to wander around. One of the places they visit is the silage racks which are in a room under a shelter. The cows prefer the silage to hay, which is also fed to them from racks. The third type of food fed to the cows is called cake. {* * * * * * * * As there are fifty-five cows,you can imagine how much slurry there is. It gets put into a big tank and when the tank is full, the slurry gets pumped into a tanker that sprays slurry out onto the fields.The cows sleep in a large sheltered area. The stalls are just tiny cubicals separated by iron poles. There is just enough room for the cows to sleep.
